titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Pia-Maria Starck papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared Sally DeBauche

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-03-29T09:40-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Correpondence, minutes, reports, studies, bulletins, newsletters, pamphlets, clippings, serial issues, flyers, and leaflets, relating to student and faculty radicalism and other educational issues in West Germany.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Pia-Maria Starck papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2004.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Member, Vorstand Hessen, Katholische Elternschaft Deutschlands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Starck papers represent a wide range of views regarding education reform in West Germany during the 1960s-1980s, represented through a large collection of printed matter published by various political and social advocacy groups. The collection is arranged into three sections: a Subject File, Writings by Others, and Printed Matter.

The Subject File is comprised of a variety of materials collected by Starck on issues related to education reform. These files contain articles, newspaper clippings, and other printed materials, divided by specific topics.
The Writings by Others file is comprised of articles written predominately by German authors on various subjects related to education.

The Printed Matter file makes up the largest section of the collection. It is comprised of German serials, pamphlets, fliers, and other published items related to education. These materials represent a wide spectrum of political and social stances advocated by groups such as the Katholische Elternschaft Deutschlands, the Sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands, and the Christlich Demokratische Union among others. This section of the collection also contains a large number of pamphlets, which are arranged according to the organization or political party that published them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of pamphlets related to West German education. Arranged in alphabetical order by the name of the publishing organization.
